laazotea.indi.server

Class INDIDevice

  • java.lang.Object
    • laazotea.indi.server.INDIDeviceListener
      • laazotea.indi.server.INDIDevice
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    laazotea.indi.INDIProtocolParser
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    INDIJavaDevice, INDINativeDevice, INDINetworkDevice

    public abstract class INDIDevice
extends INDIDeviceListener
implements laazotea.indi.INDIProtocolParser
    A class that represents a generic INDI Device to which the server connects and parses its messages.
    Version:
    1.32, January 13, 2013
    Author:
    S. Alonso (Zerjillo) [zerjioi at ugr.es]

              throws laazotea.indi.INDIException

      • startReading

      • parseXML

        public void parseXML(org.w3c.dom.Document doc)
        Specified by:

      • dealWithPossibleNewDeviceName

        protected abstract void dealWithPossibleNewDeviceName(java.lang.String possibleNewName)
        Deals with a possible new Device name. If the device is a single one it just stores the name if none has been previously fixed. In case of a multiple device (like a Network one) it will probably add it to a list.
        Parameters:
        possibleNewName - The new possible new name.

      • hasName

        protected abstract boolean hasName(java.lang.String name)
        Checks if the Device has a particular name. Specially important for multiple name devices (Network ones).
        Parameters:
        name - The name to check.
        Returns:
        true if the Device respond to name. false otherwise.

      • getNames

        protected abstract java.lang.String[] getNames()
        Gets the names that the Device is attending (might be more than one in Network Devices).
        Returns:
        the names that the Device is attending.

        Stops the reader and closes its connections.
